page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: We interviewed a lady named Mary Patience in Hilton. She is 73 years old and has lived in Hilton for 68 years. She remembers when Hilton had only two houses with a slated roof, the rest had a thatch or clay roof. A daily chore was fetching water from the well as there was no water or electricity supply.It was in 1949 and 1950 that these became available. Today the small fisher houses have all been extended and improved. She remembers when most of the people were Patience,Ross, Skinner or Vass. Today she says that she hardly knows a quarter of the people she meets and where nearly everyone was a relative they are now stramgers. She remembers the poverty of the people when she was young and is pleased that her children are so much better provided for.
